quest.name: Star-crossed Rivals
journal: Hamon appears to be in higher spirits.
In his eagerness to regain his former strength, Hamon has overtrained and injured himself. Once again, he bids you seek out Chuchuto for your next lesson.
Chuchuto has a challenge in mind that you should find stimulating. Make ready for your lesson, and rendezvous with her at Little Ala Mhigo in southern Thanalan.
It turns out your training is to help prepare for Master Hamon's training. Take the striking dummies Chuchuto has entrusted to you, and deploy them at the specified locations.
You have deployed all the striking dummies. Report back to Chuchuto.

Upon returning to Little Ala Mhigo, you are suddenly assailed by Rurukuta and his minions. With Chuchuto's aid, you succeed in subduing him, and finally learn his true agenda. Rurukuta only wants his master to live, even if it means swallowing his pride and running from the impending fight. Satisfied that Hamon is in good hands, Rurukuta takes his leave. Return to the Pugilists' Guild and report all that transpired to your guildmaster.

While appreciative of Rurukuta's sentiments, Hamon is more determined than ever to confront Weggfarr. He bids you keep up your training, lest you be left behind in his dusty wake.

※The next pugilist quest will be available from Hamon upon reaching level 30.
objectives: Meet Chuchuto at Little Ala Mhigo.
Report to Hamon at the Pugilists' Guild.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Hah hah hah! I swear, each time I see you, you remind me more and more of my younger self. At this rate, you're like to transform into a handsome devil before the moon's over!

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Now then, I believe you're here to learn. Unfortunately, I'm in no condition to teach.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: This is rather embarrassing to admit...but in my eagerness to prepare for the big rematch, I've overtrained and thrown my back out. <groan> I tell you, old age is hells... I fear Chuchuto will have to tend to you in my stead.

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: It seems the prospect of facing his old rival has lit a veritable fire under Master Hamon's backside. I am so relieved to see that he has a purpose again. The trick now is to keep a lid on his zeal, lest he injure himself!

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: But let us speak of your lesson. When you are ready, come and meet me at Little Ala Mhigo. I have a challenge in mind that you are certain to find...stimulating!

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: I've been waiting for you, Forename. Today, your training will be...to prepare for Master Hamon's training!

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: I've brought with me a set of striking dummies, and I want you to deploy them at certain locations.

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Lest you think this task to be drudgery, the locations are rife with peril. Your skills will most certainly be put to the test.

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: By way of advice, if you must approach dangerous fiends, lightness of foot is your greatest ally.

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Off with you now, Forename─go set up those striking dummies. I shall await your return!

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: How goes it? Let me know when you have deployed all the striking dummies.

dialogue.name: SCENE00012
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Proceed with
“Star-crossed Rivals”?

dialogue.name: SCENE00012
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: SCENE00012
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Excellent work, Forename! All that's left is to have Master Hamon come and train!

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: What are you doing here!?

dialogue.name: RURUKUTA
dialogue.text: That adventurer is a negative influence on Master Hamon. I'm going to see to it shehe never bothers him again.

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: What are you talking about!? Forename's the best thing that's happened to Master in years! If you want a piece of herhim, you'll need to deal with me, too!

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Why, Rurukuta? Why are you so bent on bringing down Master Hamon and seeing the guild in ruins?

dialogue.name: RURUKUTA
dialogue.text: You have it all wrong! I'm doing this for Master's own sake!

dialogue.name: RURUKUTA
dialogue.text: It's true I left the guild for the shock of seeing Master in that pathetic state. And it's true I got involved with some unsavory types. But where else was I supposed to go? Me, a refugee without a gil to his name!

dialogue.name: RURUKUTA
dialogue.text: But for all the ungrateful things I've done, I've never forgotten how Master Hamon took me in and instructed me in the ways of the fist. This is why I want him to give up his foolish notion of facing Weggfarr.

dialogue.name: RURUKUTA
dialogue.text: You don't know that man like I do, Chuchuto. Should this fight come to pass, I fear Master won't walk away with his life.

dialogue.name: RURUKUTA
dialogue.text: It doesn't matter that Master has grown weak and feeble. I just want him to live, even if it means having him swallow his pride.

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Oh, Rurukuta... Why didn't you just say so?

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: But now that I know your mind, I can say with confidence that you have no cause to fear.

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Forename is not the plague that you think shehe is. It's herhis will to succeed that's inspiring Master to regain his former strength. And when the day of the rematch finally comes, I've no doubt he will wallop that odious Weggfarr to the seventh hell and back!

dialogue.name: RURUKUTA
dialogue.text: I pray you're right. But whatever happens, know that I cannot help you, not where I am. Chuchuto, Forename...I leave Master Hamon in your care.

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Gods, that felt liberating! Trading blows with Rurukuta and learning his true agenda─a great burden has been lifted off my chest!

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Let us return to the guild, Forename. You've had your training, and now it's time for Master Hamon's!

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. I'm told you've kindly set up some dummies for me.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: But gods, womanman, did you have to put them in such dangerous places!?

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: To make matters worse, Chuchuto's hidden my grog and says I won't see a drop of it till I've finished training! How the hells am I supposed to loosen my phlegm now!? <cough> <cough>

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: <sigh> That girl will make a fine guildmaster when the time comes...

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: I heard about Rurukuta as well, of course. For all his shortcomings, the boy has a good heart.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: But while his concern is touching, I won't run from Weggfarr! Not today, and not ever!

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: On that note, I'd best get ready for my little jaunt to Little Ala Mhigo. If I can't face down a few mindless beasts, I'm in no shape to challenge Weggfarr. Don't slack off, Forename, or I'll leave you in my dusty wake!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Out of my way, Chuchuto!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: No! I won't let you hurt Forename!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Hounds! Tear that womanman apart!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The war hound is trouble, Forename! Finish it quick as you can!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Grrr... You leave me no choice!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: A bastet!? Where did you find that thing!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: That creature will sap your strength! Avoid its gaze!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Urgh... You've grown strong, Rurukuta!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Y-You leave Forename...alone...
